CoverageType.name: CoverageType
CoverageType.description: Represents the type of coverage, such as liability, earthquake, or collision damage. You see this object only if you have enabled the Access Master List of Coverage Types org pref.

BenefitPaymentFrequency.description: The frequency of the payment if the benefit or coverage entails a recurring payout to the insured.

Category.description: The category that the coverage belongs to. For example, benefit, clause, deductible, rider.

CategoryCode.description: A carrier-specific code that identifies the coverage. For example, benefit, clause, or deductible.

CategoryGroup.description: The specific category group. For example, for a liability coverage record, benefit is the category and liability is the category group.

CategoryGroupType.description: The type of the category group.

CategoryGroupTypeValue.description: Identifies the coverage limit type. For example, for a liability coverage of USD 1000 per person and USD 1500 per occurrence, Amount per Person and Amount per Occurrence are the category group type values.

CoverageCode.description: A carrier-specific code that identifies the policy limit code in the source system.

DeathBenefitOptionType.description: The method for the payment of death benefit.

DeductibleAmount.description: The deductible amount that the customer must pay.

Description.description: The description of the coverage type.

Discount.description: The discount that was given on the coverage or the benefit.

EffectiveDate.description: The date from which the coverage is in effect.

ExpirationDate.description: The date on which the coverage expires.

IncomeOptionType.description: The type of the income option given to the policy participant. For example, periodic payment is an income option type, and annuity is an income option.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, itâ€™s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

LimitAmount.description: The limit of the fixed coverage amount. For example, uninsured motorist coverage of USD 1000.

LimitDate.description: The date from which the coverage limit is in effect. For example, an annuity benefit is valid only after the insured is 60 years old.

LimitPercentage.description: The percentage of the actuals covered by this coverage.

LimitRange.description: The range of the coverage limit. For example, bodily injury coverage with limits as USD 100,000 per person and USD 300,000 per accident.

Name.description: An auto-generated number assigned to this record.

PremiumAmount.description: The premium paid by the customer for this coverage.

SourceSystem.description: The name of the source system this record was obtained from.

SourceSystemIdentifier.description: The ID of this coverage record in the source system.
